items.description: Inventory repository modules and artifacts, including main.py, TASK_orchestrator.md, and output directories
items.acceptance_criteria: Produce a module map that lists every file/directory in scope with purpose, owner agent, and dependency links; cover 100% of current repo files
items.notes: Created results/item_001_module_map.json with complete 100% repo coverage (17/17 entries), including purpose, owner agent, and dependency links; seed=42 metadata recorded.

items.description: Define formal 5D chess problem statement, objective function, and game outcome conventions
items.acceptance_criteria: Write a one-page spec with state, action, transition, reward, terminal conditions, and tie-breaking rules; include at least 3 worked examples

items.description: Estimate environment complexity and computational constraints for 5D chess search and training
items.acceptance_criteria: Report branching factor, typical game length, memory footprint per state encoding, and projected GPU-hours for pilot training within +/-20% confidence

items.description: Review state-of-the-art methods relevant to AlphaGo-style systems and large-action-space board games
items.acceptance_criteria: Curate at least 15 primary sources spanning MCTS, policy-value networks, self-play RL, MuZero-style dynamics, and transformer-based game agents with 2-3 sentence takeaways each

items.description: Translate literature into testable hypotheses tailored to 5D chess
items.acceptance_criteria: Define at least 5 falsifiable hypotheses, each with independent/dependent variables, expected effect direction, and success threshold

items.description: Specify canonical game engine API and correctness tests for legal move generation
items.acceptance_criteria: Define deterministic API signatures and pass a regression suite of at least 200 hand-verified positions with 99.5%+ legal-move agreement

items.description: Design baseline state/action encodings suitable for neural and tree-search components
items.acceptance_criteria: Provide tensor schemas, action indexing rules, and encode/decode round-trip tests with zero mismatches over 10,000 random states

items.description: Establish non-learning search baselines for reference strength and speed
items.acceptance_criteria: Implement and benchmark at least 3 baselines (e.g., random, heuristic minimax/alpha-beta, plain MCTS) over 1,000 games with Elo and nodes/sec reported

items.description: Define evaluation protocol, data splits, and statistical significance standards
items.acceptance_criteria: Publish a locked protocol specifying seeds, match formats, confidence intervals, and minimum sample sizes; include power analysis targeting 95% confidence and 80% power

items.description: Build experiment tracking schema for reproducible research
items.acceptance_criteria: Capture config hash, code revision, hardware profile, and metrics for every run; reproduce one baseline result within 2% variance across 3 reruns

items.description: Design AlphaGo-style policy-value network architecture for 5D spatiotemporal board structure
items.acceptance_criteria: Produce architecture spec with parameter count, receptive field rationale, and latency target; run ablation plan comparing at least 3 candidate backbones

items.description: Develop PUCT-based MCTS adapted for trans-dimensional move priors and virtual loss parallelism
items.acceptance_criteria: Document equations and implementation plan, then validate search invariants (visit monotonicity, prior normalization, backup correctness) on 100 synthetic trees

items.description: Specify self-play training curriculum with replay buffer governance
items.acceptance_criteria: Define temperature schedule, resignation policy, sampling weights, and windowing strategy; include target game generation rate and buffer diversity metrics

items.description: Propose at least two novel efficiency methods beyond standard AlphaGo pipeline
items.acceptance_criteria: Detail two methods (e.g., symmetry-aware caching, learned move-pruning, latent dynamics rollout) with complexity analysis and clear experimental comparison criteria

items.description: Define safety and robustness mechanisms against training collapse and exploit loops
items.acceptance_criteria: List failure detectors, trigger thresholds, and rollback strategies; simulate at least 4 failure modes and verify each detector fires within 50 training steps

items.description: Run controlled ablations for architecture, search depth, and training schedule
items.acceptance_criteria: Execute at least 12 ablation runs under fixed compute budget and report Elo delta, inference cost, and wall-clock efficiency per run

items.description: Benchmark versus baseline agents and earlier checkpoints
items.acceptance_criteria: Play a minimum of 5,000 rated games across opponents and time controls; report Elo with 95% CIs and statistically significant win-rate gains over strongest baseline

items.description: Evaluate sample efficiency and compute efficiency tradeoffs
items.acceptance_criteria: Produce curves for Elo vs self-play games and Elo vs GPU-hours; identify Pareto frontier and select best operating point under predefined budget

items.description: Assess generalization across unseen openings, timeline structures, and adversarial styles
items.acceptance_criteria: Create at least 3 held-out scenario suites and measure performance drop relative to in-distribution; require <10% Elo degradation on two of three suites

items.description: Perform error analysis on tactical misses and strategic horizon failures
items.acceptance_criteria: Annotate 200 loss/draw positions, categorize root causes, and map top 3 error categories to concrete remediation experiments

items.description: Synthesize final results against initial hypotheses and success criteria
items.acceptance_criteria: For each hypothesis from Phase 1, report supported/rejected status with quantitative evidence and p-values or confidence intervals

items.description: Document full system architecture and research decisions
items.acceptance_criteria: Deliver a technical design document with component diagrams, interface contracts, and rationale for all major algorithmic choices; include 100% cross-references to experiments

items.description: Package reproducibility artifacts for independent reruns
items.acceptance_criteria: Provide runbooks, pinned dependencies, config snapshots, and seed lists sufficient for a third party to reproduce headline results within 5% Elo

items.description: Prepare publication-grade reporting assets and visualizations
items.acceptance_criteria: Generate at least 10 final figures/tables covering learning curves, ablations, and error taxonomies with captions and statistical notes

items.description: Define next-iteration roadmap with risk-adjusted prioritization
items.acceptance_criteria: Produce a ranked backlog of >=12 follow-up tasks with impact, effort, risk scores, and quarter-by-quarter execution plan
